intro: Licania fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered licania, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Licania fasciculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
